author: .vbuterin
content: One deeper philosophical question with the "standardized log" route is: are logs even part of the long-term future?

author: .vbuterin
content: The whole "clients do bloom filter checks at block level and then at tx level to find logs corresponding to some keys" thing is arguably based on outdated technology

author: .vbuterin
content: There are much better (eg. ZK-SNARK-based) untrusted-server-based ways to get data about chain execution

author: .vbuterin
content: And lots of dapps are switching to eg. TheGraph because it's faster than "regular" log scanning already

author: .vbuterin
content: So in the long term, we may well end up almost removing logs from the core ethereum protocol; maybe we'll add a convenience feature where a merkle root of the logs gets saved

author: .vbuterin
content: And then we can safely reduce the gas cost of those opcodes to near-zero

author: .vbuterin
content: Infinite gas stipend definitely intuitively feels like it will break more dapps and break them in a more severe way than zero gas stipend

author: .vbuterin
content: 2300 gas is not enough to make state changes, so a zero gas stipend really would only kill the logs, so there would have to be standardized logs

author: sky.cactus
content: It would trigger an OOG revert where there wasn't a revert previously.

author: sky.cactus
content: All gas though would allow reentry where reentry was previously not possible.

author: uink45
content: Thanks for the response. In that case, I will continue researching on the zero gas stipend and identify how logs can be standardised at the protocol level. Although, I will be keeping in mind that logs will be removed in the future.
